alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 7:02PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern San Juan and southwestern Grand Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 701 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Canyonlands National Park, or 21 miles southwest of Moab, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern San Juan and southwestern Grand Counties, including the following locations... Dead Horse Point State Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 132 and 139. Utah 279 between mile markers 3 and 4. Utah 313 between mile markers 0 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges
